title: UDL-Based VR Language Education Course Design: Exploring Incidental Application Cases

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Customized training to improve workplace language proficiency according to job-specific contexts.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize appropriate language expressions for work-related situations (meetings, presentations, negotiations) with 80% accuracy in a VR simulation environment
Learners can interpret language content provided through multiple sensory channels (visual, auditory, interactive) in three or more ways
Through project-based task performance, learners can autonomously design language expression strategies in a learning environment applying UDL principles
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
